alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Ohio (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 1:16PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO...SOUTHEASTERN DEARBORN...KENTON...BOONE...NORTHERN CAMPBELL...SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER...NORTHERN CLERMONT...WEST CENTRAL FAYETTE...HAMILTON... NORTHWESTERN BROWN...WARREN...NORTHERN CLINTON...SOUTHERN GREENE AND SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 145 PM EST... At 115 PM EST, snow showers were located along a line extending from Beavercreek to near Lawrenceburg, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Rapid reductions in visibility may cause travel difficulties. In addition, bridges and overpasses may become briefly snow covered and slick. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Kettering, Middletown, Beavercreek, Fairfield, Covington, Fairborn, Mason, Florence, Xenia, Independence, Miamisburg, Lebanon, Norwood, Forest Park, Erlanger, Springboro, Fort Thomas, and Newport. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 76 and 77. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 62. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 3 and 19. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 172 and 191. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 45. Exercise extra caution while traveling. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
